ThingDef.label: abyssinian cat
ThingDef.description: A slender, fine-boned, medium sized shrubland cat.

ThingDef.label: bengal cat
ThingDef.description: A domesticated hybrid of a domestic cat and tropical leopard.

ThingDef.label: british shorthair cat
ThingDef.description: A pedigreed version of a regular british cat, with a distinctively chunky body, dense coat and a very broad face. While being relatively powerful-looking due to the large chest and massive paws, these cats are absolutely harmless.

ThingDef.label: maine coon
ThingDef.description: A largest domesticated cat, it has a distinctive physical appearance and valuable hunting skills. It's a large and sociable cat, hence it has been given a nickname "the gentle giant."

ThingDef.label: munchkin cat
ThingDef.description: Also known as a sausage cat, this new cat breed has distinctively short legs. Sweet natured, playful and people-oriented, these cats are perfect companions for people with lazy lifestyle.

ThingDef.label: norwegian forest cat
ThingDef.description: A cat adapted for very cold climates due to the top coat of glossy, water-shedding hair.

ThingDef.label: persian cat
ThingDef.description: A long haired cat originating from desert wildcats, Persian cats are regal, intelligent and agile, which makes them excellent for hunting small rodents and birds.

ThingDef.label: siamese cat
ThingDef.description: A cat with distinctively triangular head, blue eyes and long and muscular body, renowned for it's social nature.

ThingDef.label: somali cat
ThingDef.description: A shrubland cat, sharing the same family as the Abyssinian cat. It has a bushy tail and almond shaped eyes.

ThingDef.label: sphynx cat
ThingDef.description: A cat known for it's lack of fur, developed due to selective breeding. Being warm to the touch, they lose body temperature easily which makes it seek out heat sources.
